page.title: 20Memories of Chelsfield.1921
page.content: {The following is an extract of life in Chelsfield in 1921.} .."Life in Chelsfield Village in 1921 was so very different from what it is today.Practically all our entertainment centred around the life and activities of the village.For the younger there were the Scouts and Guides, for the older members of the community there was the newly founded Womens Institute or the Chelsfield Players....Chelsfield was very much a farming community with well known names like Whitehead,Miller, Smith and Foreman.Mr.G.J.Miller was better known in those days as a wheel- wright who made and patented a special non-slip wheel for agricultural work." {Credits} All work was written and supplied by the children of Chelsfield and members of the local community.
